subject: Re: George Fischer <> Dice || Spends Management Simplified
body:
Hi Sanjay & Vipin,

Greetings of the day!

I wanted to follow up on the NDA we shared earlier. Please let us know if
you have any comments, and once finalized, we can proceed with signatures.

In the meantime, if the NDA process is taking time, could you kindly share
the User Details and Policy Matrix? This will allow us to begin configuring
the dashboard while the NDA is being finalized.

For reference, I’ve attached a sheet with two tabs:

   - *Policy Matrix* – Please fill in the policy limits for each employee
   grade across different expense categories.
   - *User Details* – Kindly provide user information in the specified
   format.

Additionally, let us know if you'd like to schedule a call tomorrow or next
week to clarify any details regarding the policy matrix and user
information.

Looking forward to your response. Please feel free to reach out if you have
any questions.

Best regards,

>>> Hi Sanjay,
>>>
>>> Thanks for your time on the call today.
>>>
>>> The use case revolves around efficiently distinguishing between
>>> business-related visits and personal visits throughout the day, without the
>>> need for repeatedly starting and stopping journey tracking.
>>>
>>> Our proposed solution addresses this challenge by introducing a
>>> *Check-In* functionality at each client location. This allows users to
>>> mark business visits seamlessly while providing the option to tag
>>> deviations for personal trips, ensuring these are excluded from business
>>> visits.
>>>
>>> This approach offers *enhanced compliance and visibility* by capturing
>>> end-to-end information on client interactions and visit patterns.
>>> Additionally, with our solution, all visit data can be seamlessly synced
>>> with your CRM, creating a unified and accurate view of client engagements
>>>
>>> Here's a quick case study for your reference on the similar use case.
>>>

>>>> *Questionnaire for Expense Tracking System:*
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> 1. Does Expense Tracking System’s APIs work two-way integration? Does
>>>> it support SOAP based web services or REST API protocols.
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> 2. Any prior experience for Integration with Oracle E-Business Suite
>>>> (ERP)? Any case study with Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC).
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> 3. Few additional attributes are required to generate payable invoices
>>>> in EBS (e.g., Org ID, Vendor ID, Vendor Site ID),
>>>>
>>>>      Kindly confirm in case Expense Tracking System can accommodate new
>>>> attributes in GUI as well as in APIs.
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> 4. Is there any specific API endpoint for uploading or retrieving
>>>> attachments?
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> 5. Is it possible to share detailed API documentation for the Expense
>>>> Tracking System, including supported endpoints, request/response formats,
>>>> and payload examples?
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> 6. What authentication mechanisms APIs supports (e.g., OAuth 2.0, API
>>>> keys)?
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> 7. Is there any IP whitelisting option or additional security
>>>> requirements that needs to be configured?
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> 8. What is the API payload size and call limits for API requests?
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> 9. Is there any maximum size limit for attachments and what are the
>>>> supported formats (e.g., PDF, JPEG, PNG)?
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> 10. How integration errors are communicated (e.g., error codes,
>>>> response messages)?
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> 11. Does APIs support retry mechanisms for failed transactions?
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> 12. Is there a sandbox or test environment we can use for integration
>>>> testing?
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> 13. What format and data structure is required for sending batch
>>>> element entries (e.g., JSON, XML)?
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> 14. Is there a unique identifier for each element entry to ensure no
>>>> duplicate processing in Oracle?
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> 15. Is there an acknowledgment mechanism to confirm successful receipt
>>>> of processed results in Expense Tracking System?
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> 16. Does Expense Tracking Software APIs support attachments (e.g.,
>>>> expense receipts) along with batch entries?
>>>>
>>>>         If yes, how are these attachments linked to a specific
>>>> transaction?
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> 17. How does Expense Tracking System handle invoice status updates sent
>>>> back from Oracle?
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> 18. How frequently should the payment status updates be sent to Expense
>>>> Tracking System (real-time, scheduled batches)?
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> 19. Is there a way to log or track changes for audit purposes?
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> 20. Please outline the expected response times (latency) and any
>>>> defined timeouts for the Expense Tracking System APIs.
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> 21. How does API versioning and backward compatibility is being handled.
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> 22. Does ExTS supports bulk upload to Employee Master through Excel /
>>>> CSV file.
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> 23. Does ExTS supports bulk upload through excel / CSV file to other
>>>> masters like Expense Type / Account Codes etc.
>>>>
>>>>

Hi Manohar / Sonam,




Greetings again.




Thanks for your time and support with the refresher demo today.




Kindly find the queries from the ERP team that Kashif mentioned during our meeting today for your review and feedback.




Questionnaire for Expense Tracking System:

 

1. Does Expense Tracking System’s APIs work two-way integration? Does it support SOAP based web services or REST API protocols.

 

2. Any prior experience for Integration with Oracle E-Business Suite (ERP)? Any case study with Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC).

 

3. Few additional attributes are required to generate payable invoices in EBS (e.g., Org ID, Vendor ID, Vendor Site ID),

     Kindly confirm in case Expense Tracking System can accommodate new attributes in GUI as well as in APIs.

              

4. Is there any specific API endpoint for uploading or retrieving attachments?

 

5. Is it possible to share detailed API documentation for the Expense Tracking System, including supported endpoints, request/response formats, and payload
 examples?

 

6. What authentication mechanisms APIs supports (e.g., OAuth 2.0, API keys)?

 

7. Is there any IP whitelisting option or additional security requirements that needs to be configured?

 

8. What is the API payload size and call limits for API requests?

 

9. Is there any maximum size limit for attachments and what are the supported formats (e.g., PDF, JPEG, PNG)?

 

10. How integration errors are communicated (e.g., error codes, response messages)?

 

11. Does APIs support retry mechanisms for failed transactions?

 

12. Is there a sandbox or test environment we can use for integration testing?

 

13. What format and data structure is required for sending batch element entries (e.g., JSON, XML)?

 

14. Is there a unique identifier for each element entry to ensure no duplicate processing in Oracle?

 

15. Is there an acknowledgment mechanism to confirm successful receipt of processed results in Expense Tracking System?

 

16. Does Expense Tracking Software APIs support attachments (e.g., expense receipts) along with batch entries?

        If yes, how are these attachments linked to a specific transaction?

              

17. How does Expense Tracking System handle invoice status updates sent back from Oracle?

 

18. How frequently should the payment status updates be sent to Expense Tracking System (real-time, scheduled batches)?

 

19. Is there a way to log or track changes for audit purposes?

 

20. Please outline the expected response times (latency) and any defined timeouts for the Expense Tracking System APIs.

 

21. How does API versioning and backward compatibility is being handled.

 

22. Does ExTS supports bulk upload to Employee Master through Excel / CSV file.

 

23. Does ExTS supports bulk upload through excel / CSV file to other masters like Expense Type / Account Codes etc.

body:
Hi Viral,

I hope you are keeping well.

In line with our discussion regarding the VISA flow integration via Stanbic
for Tolaram Group—we’re ready to kick-start the implementation. Can you
confirm whether we are connecting directly with VISA or routing it through
Stanbic Bank. Also, what’s the fastest and most efficient way to proceed.

We've already initiated the PCI DSS certification, so it would be great if
you could help expedite the process from your end. Our go-live is set for
the last week of March 2025, which leaves us with just six weeks to
finalize everything. We would appreciate a quick update on the next steps
to ensure a smooth rollout.

Looking forward to your guidance and support.

Regards,


*Manohar+91 903 600 5577www.dice.tech <http://www.eka.io/> II Smarter Spend
Management*

subject: Re: George Fischer <> Dice || Spends Management Simplified
body:
Hi Sanjay & Vipin,

Greetings of the day!

Please find attached the NDA for your review. Let us know if you have any
comments. Once finalized, we can proceed with signatures.

Additionally, I’m sharing a policy document for your reference. Could you
also confirm the number of users you'd like to start with?

Attached is a sheet with two tabs:

   - Policy Matrix – Please fill in the policy limits for each employee
   grade across different expense categories.
   - User Details – Kindly provide user information in the specified format.

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,

On Sat, Feb 1, 2025 at 10:48 AM Sonam Khubchandani <sonam@dice.tech> wrote:

> Hi Sanjay,
>
> Vipin mentioned that you require a quick POC. Can we get on a quick call

>
> @Ayush, please share the NDA from our end to signed.
>

> On Thu, 16 Jan 2025 at 5:34 PM, Sonam Khubchandani <sonam@dice.tech>
> wrote:

>> Hi Sanjay,
>>
>> Thanks for your time on the call today.
>>
>> The use case revolves around efficiently distinguishing between
>> business-related visits and personal visits throughout the day, without the
>> need for repeatedly starting and stopping journey tracking.
>>
>> Our proposed solution addresses this challenge by introducing a
>> *Check-In* functionality at each client location. This allows users to
>> mark business visits seamlessly while providing the option to tag
>> deviations for personal trips, ensuring these are excluded from business
>> visits.
>>
>> This approach offers *enhanced compliance and visibility* by capturing
>> end-to-end information on client interactions and visit patterns.
>> Additionally, with our solution, all visit data can be seamlessly synced
>> with your CRM, creating a unified and accurate view of client engagements
>>
>> Here's a quick case study for your reference on the similar use case.
>>

Hi Manohar / Sonam,




Greetings again.




Thanks for your time and support with the refresher demo today.




Kindly find the queries from the ERP team that Kashif mentioned during our meeting today for your review and feedback.




Questionnaire for Expense Tracking System:

 

1. Does Expense Tracking System’s APIs work two-way integration? Does it support SOAP based web services or REST API protocols.

 

2. Any prior experience for Integration with Oracle E-Business Suite (ERP)? Any case study with Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC).

 

3. Few additional attributes are required to generate payable invoices in EBS (e.g., Org ID, Vendor ID, Vendor Site ID),

     Kindly confirm in case Expense Tracking System can accommodate new attributes in GUI as well as in APIs.

              

4. Is there any specific API endpoint for uploading or retrieving attachments?

 

5. Is it possible to share detailed API documentation for the Expense Tracking System, including supported endpoints, request/response formats, and payload
 examples?

 

6. What authentication mechanisms APIs supports (e.g., OAuth 2.0, API keys)?

 

7. Is there any IP whitelisting option or additional security requirements that needs to be configured?

 

8. What is the API payload size and call limits for API requests?

 

9. Is there any maximum size limit for attachments and what are the supported formats (e.g., PDF, JPEG, PNG)?

 

10. How integration errors are communicated (e.g., error codes, response messages)?

 

11. Does APIs support retry mechanisms for failed transactions?

 

12. Is there a sandbox or test environment we can use for integration testing?

 

13. What format and data structure is required for sending batch element entries (e.g., JSON, XML)?

 

14. Is there a unique identifier for each element entry to ensure no duplicate processing in Oracle?

 

15. Is there an acknowledgment mechanism to confirm successful receipt of processed results in Expense Tracking System?

 

16. Does Expense Tracking Software APIs support attachments (e.g., expense receipts) along with batch entries?

        If yes, how are these attachments linked to a specific transaction?

              

17. How does Expense Tracking System handle invoice status updates sent back from Oracle?

 

18. How frequently should the payment status updates be sent to Expense Tracking System (real-time, scheduled batches)?

 

19. Is there a way to log or track changes for audit purposes?

 

20. Please outline the expected response times (latency) and any defined timeouts for the Expense Tracking System APIs.

 

21. How does API versioning and backward compatibility is being handled.

 

22. Does ExTS supports bulk upload to Employee Master through Excel / CSV file.

 

23. Does ExTS supports bulk upload through excel / CSV file to other masters like Expense Type / Account Codes etc.










Best regards

On Thu, 16 Jan 2025 at 5:34 PM, Sonam Khubchandani <sonam@dice.tech> wrote:

> Hi Sanjay,
>
> Thanks for your time on the call today.
>
> The use case revolves around efficiently distinguishing between
> business-related visits and personal visits throughout the day, without the
> need for repeatedly starting and stopping journey tracking.
>
> Our proposed solution addresses this challenge by introducing a *Check-In*
> functionality at each client location. This allows users to mark business
> visits seamlessly while providing the option to tag deviations for personal
> trips, ensuring these are excluded from business visits.
>
> This approach offers *enhanced compliance and visibility* by capturing
> end-to-end information on client interactions and visit patterns.
> Additionally, with our solution, all visit data can be seamlessly synced
> with your CRM, creating a unified and accurate view of client engagements
>
> Here's a quick case study for your reference on the similar use case.
>

This allows users to mark business visits seamlessly while providing the option to tag deviations for personal trips, ensuring these are excluded from business visits.This approach offers enhanced compliance and visibility by capturing end-to-end information on client interactions and visit patterns. subject: Work From Home Request Due to Injury
body:
Hi Abhishek Sir,

I wanted to inform you that I have injured my foot and have been diagnosed
with a fracture, requiring a plaster for one month. Given this, I will be
traveling to my hometown for recovery and will be working from home during
this period.

I will ensure that my responsibilities are handled smoothly and remain
available for any work-related discussions. I’ll keep you updated on my
progress and will return to the office as soon as the plaster is removed.

Thank you for your support and understanding.

Best regards,


*Himanshi JoshiGrowth Consultant*

*+91-9630827366*

Dice

On Thu, Jan 30, 2025 at 10:50 AM Ayush Srivastava <ayush.srivastava@antrepriz.com<mailto:ayush.srivastava@antrepriz.com>> wrote:
Hi Santhosh,

I hope you're doing well!

I tried reaching out to you but was unable to connect. I wanted to follow up on my previous email regarding the POC for Dice’s Track Mileage module. We’d love to hear your feedback on its performance and whether it meets your expectations. Your insights will be invaluable in refining the solution to better suit your needs.

If there are any challenges or areas for improvement, please feel free to share—we’re here to support you and ensure a seamless experience.

Looking forward to your thoughts!

Best regards,

On Wed, Jan 22, 2025 at 5:28 PM Ayush Srivastava <ayush.srivastava@antrepriz.com<mailto:ayush.srivastava@antrepriz.com>> wrote:
Hi Santhosh and Peraiah,

I hope this email finds you well!

As the POC for Dice's Track Mileage module is currently underway, I wanted to touch base and gather your thoughts so far. Your feedback is invaluable in ensuring we align with your expectations and fine-tune the solution for optimal performance.

Here are a few areas we’d love to hear your insights on:

  *   How user-friendly is the Track Mileage module for your employees?
  *   Are the automated reimbursement calculations meeting your expectations?
  *   Is GPS-based tracking providing accurate journey logs?
  *   Are the approval workflows functioning smoothly as per your policies?
  *   Have the MIS reports provided actionable insights for your team?

If there are any challenges, suggestions, or additional features you’d like to explore, do let us know. We’re here to support you and make the POC as effective as possible.

Looking forward to your feedback and any further guidance you may have.

Best regards,

On Mon, Jan 13, 2025 at 6:16 PM Ayush Srivastava <ayush.srivastava@antrepriz.com<mailto:ayush.srivastava@antrepriz.com>> wrote:

Hi Santhosh,

Thank you for taking the time to join the call today and for bringing your users on the call!

As discussed on the call today, we observed variations in the actual distance and odometer readings for some users. Upon reviewing their device settings, we identified potential issues that may have contributed to these discrepancies. We have now configured the correct settings for the users, and this feature should function properly moving forward.

Let’s reconnect on Wednesday to review and confirm if the issue has been resolved.

Thank you for your cooperation, and please let me know if there’s anything else in the meantime.

Best regards,

body:
Hi Santhosh,

I hope you're doing well!

I tried reaching out to you but was unable to connect. I wanted to follow
up on my previous email regarding the POC for Dice’s Track Mileage module.
We’d love to hear your feedback on its performance and whether it meets
your expectations. Your insights will be invaluable in refining the
solution to better suit your needs.

If there are any challenges or areas for improvement, please feel free to
share—we’re here to support you and ensure a seamless experience.

Looking forward to your thoughts!

Best regards,

> As we approach the end of the month, I'am sharing the monthly
> attendance report, as part of our ongoing efforts to regularise attendance
> & enhance transparency. Please take a moment to review your attendance
> records for the month. Payroll will be processed based on the attendance
> sheet, so it’s important to address any discrepancies at the earliest.
>
> You can access the attendance sheet via the following link:
> https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1K_b5ElUlnxnnJYwhK2CwEb6_nymnzrv-n8UkmDNiUBU/edit?usp=sharing
>
> If there are any discrepancies, please submit your attendance
> regularization request to your respective manager via *Zoho People* and
> ensure it is approved no later than January 30th, 2025. *Payroll will now
> be processed automatically using biometric attendance records and approved
> leaves from Zoho People, and neither the HR nor the Finance teams will be
> responsible, as the process is fully automated.*
>
> If you encounter any challenges or have questions, please feel free to
> reach out directly to me
>
> Thanks & Regards,
>
>
> *Jeemit ChakmaManager - People & Culture*
>
> +91 7356638988
>
> Dice

Hi Jeemit , I reviewed my attendance and noticed that I was late by 15-20 minutes on some days, though I stayed in the office past 6:30 PM most days . Additionally, I may have missed checking out on certain days. Could you please confirm if this would impact my salary for this month?I will make sure to manage my time better and be punctual going forward. Also, I wanted to clarify if the out-time is being considered in the attendance calculation.RegardsHimanshi JoshiGrowth Consultant+91-9630827366Dicewww.dice.techOn Mon, Jan 27, 2025 at 11:18 AM Jeemit Chakma <jeemit.chakma@antrepriz.com> wrote:Hi Everyone,As we approach the end of the month, I'am sharing the monthly attendance report, as part of our ongoing efforts to regularise attendance & enhance transparency. Hi Shashwat,

 

As discussed last week, please ensure the following points are included in the MSA:

*	Service Integration: ThinkWalnut will act as the TSP for billers (electricity, mobile payments, rentals, subscriptions, gas, landline bills, tax payments) and integrate with Dice via APIs for real-time and managed services.
*	Pre-Funding: Dice will pre-fund ThinkWalnut’s wallet via escrow/collection accounts to manage biller payments for the specified services.
*	Payment Guarantees: ThinkWalnut guarantees real-time payments to billers as per the payment cycle. Any service disruptions due to ThinkWalnut’s payment delays (tech or operational) will be the whole responsibility, with penalties or indemnification for repeated issues causing client business impact.
*	Revenue Sharing: Dice will pre-fund the wallet and receive shared revenue from ThinkWalnut for upfront funds and transaction-based earnings, settled monthly.
*	Invoicing: ThinkWalnut will invoice Dice directly for service charges and transactions for both bill/invoice details provided via APIs and soft copies. They cannot invoice or engage directly with Dice’s clients during the engagement and even after discontinuation of services for at least 24 months.

We are targeting the 1st Dec 2025 go-live for electricity billing, so let’s finalize the agreement this week.

@Himanshi Joshi <mailto:himanshi.joshi@antrepriz.com> – Please ensure the agreement, signed by all parties, is in my inbox by 6th Dec EOD.

@Nitesh Nahar <mailto:nitesh.nahar@antrepriz.com> – Please confirm the readiness of integration to switch the BBPS flow to ThinkWalnut by the first week. Let’s also ensure billing starts by month-end to capture revenue opportunities.


If there are any delays or blockers, let’s connect on Monday to resolve them immediately.

 

Regards,


Manohar
+91 903 600 5577
 <http://www.eka.io/> www.dice.tech II Smarter Spend Management

Hi Foram and Shivani Ma'am,


 


Pleasure connecting with you both recently. In line with our discussion on the use cases for Vianaar, we are currently working with Lohono Stays on similar requirements
 within a comparable business model. For these properties, we are automating petty cash and utility bill payments using a QR mechanism for petty cash expenses and centralized utility payments through BBPS integration.

Regarding your query on GST charges for managed services related to utility bill payments, kindly have an internal discussion with Practus auditors. Based on my interactions with the business users at Lohono Stays, GST charges cannot be additionally levied
 on the bill amount, even for managed services like mobile bills, electricity bills, water bills or statutory bill payments.

@Ayush Shrivastava – Please share the use case deck and case study for Lohono Stays covering both petty cash and utility bill management. Collect the
 relevant data and provide the commercials accordingly.

Kindly let me know the next round of discussions with the relevant team to dive deeper into petty cash and payables automation.




Regards,

>>    causing client business impact.

>>    revenue from ThinkWalnut for upfront funds and transaction-based earnings,
>>    settled monthly.
>>    - *Invoicing:* ThinkWalnut will invoice Dice directly for service
>>    charges and transactions for both bill/invoice details provided via APIs
>>    and soft copies. They cannot invoice or engage directly with Dice’s clients
>>    during the engagement and even after discontinuation of services for at
>>    least 24 months.

Any service disruptions due to ThinkWalnut’s payment delays (tech or operational) will be the whole responsibility, with penalties or indemnification for repeated issues causing client business impact.Revenue Sharing: Dice will pre-fund the wallet and receive shared revenue from ThinkWalnut for upfront funds and transaction-based earnings, settled monthly.Invoicing: ThinkWalnut will invoice Dice directly for service charges and transactions for both bill/invoice details provided via APIs and soft copies. They cannot invoice or engage directly with Dice’s clients during the engagement and even after discontinuation of services for at least 24 months.We are targeting the 1st Dec 2025 go-live for electricity billing, so let’s finalize the agreement this week.@Himanshi Joshi– Please ensure the agreement, signed by all parties, is in my inbox by 6th Dec EOD.@Nitesh Nahar– Please confirm the readiness of integration to switch the BBPS flow to ThinkWalnut by the first week. Let’s also ensure billing starts by month-end to capture revenue opportunities.If there are any delays or blockers, let’s connect on Monday to resolve them immediately. Regards,Manohar+91 903 600 5577www.dice.tech II Smarter Spend Management<Dice_TWD_Agreement_04122024_.docx> <Dice_TWD_Agreement_04122024_TWD06Dec24.docx>

subject: Important | Attendance Regularization for January 2025
body:
Hi Everyone,

As we approach the end of the month, I'am sharing the monthly
attendance report, as part of our ongoing efforts to regularise attendance
& enhance transparency. Please take a moment to review your attendance
records for the month. Payroll will be processed based on the attendance
sheet, so it’s important to address any discrepancies at the earliest.

You can access the attendance sheet via the following link:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1K_b5ElUlnxnnJYwhK2CwEb6_nymnzrv-n8UkmDNiUBU/edit?usp=sharing

If there are any discrepancies, please submit your attendance
regularization request to your respective manager via *Zoho People* and
ensure it is approved no later than January 30th, 2025. *Payroll will now
be processed automatically using biometric attendance records and approved
leaves from Zoho People, and neither the HR nor the Finance teams will be
responsible, as the process is fully automated.*

If you encounter any challenges or have questions, please feel free to
reach out directly to me

Thanks & Regards,


*Jeemit ChakmaManager - People & Culture*

+91 7356638988

Dice
www.dice.tech

[image: https://www.linkedin.com/in/jeemit-chakma-610639150/]
<https://www.linkedin.com/in/jeemit-chakma-610639150/>

<http://www.dice.tech>

subject: Fwd: Dice_Air India T&E RFP Response
body:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Khushi Sinha <khushi.sinha@antrepriz.com>
Date: Thu, Nov 30, 2023 at 7:30 PM
Subject: Dice_Air India T&E RFP Response
To: <sanjay.arora@airindia.com>, <es.chahal@airindia.com>
Cc: Ishan Acharya <ishan@antrepriz.com>, Manohar Vashishta <
manohar.vashishta@antrepriz.com>, Sonam Khubchandani <sonam@antrepriz.com>


Hello Mr. Ekjyot and Mr. Sanjay,

This is Khushi, Enterprise Spend Consultant from Dice. Absolutely pleased
to e-connect with you.

We appreciate the opportunity to participate in Air India's Request for
Proposal (RFP) process for automating Employee Travel & Expenses for you.
It is with great enthusiasm that we submit our proposal to be considered
for this exciting opportunity.

Attached to this email, you will find our detailed response to the RFP,
accompanied by the following documents for your perusal-

   1. High-level Scope of Work (SOW) statement
   2. Process flow for escalations, queries and resolutions
   3. Project plan with tentative timelines
   4. Air India Supplier Code of Conduct (signed)
   5. Tata Code of Conduct (signed)

**Regarding the schedule of commercials, we will share the same post the
technical review of the platform. *

If there are any additional details or information required from our side,
please do not hesitate to let us know.

Thank you for considering Dice in your digital transformation journey. We
look forward to the possibility of a successful collaboration.


Thanks & regards,
Khushi Sinha
+91-9110060734
Dice || Corporate Spends Simplified

subject: (7/7) Monitor Your App’s Performance with LangSmith Dashboards 📊
body:
Once your LLM app is live, you'll need to monitor its real-world performance for issues.

LangSmith’s dashboards allow you to track key metrics like success rates, latency, and user feedback over time. With tracing enabled, you can visualize insights from your production traffic without sifting through logs.

You can also create custom views to track the metrics that matter most to your team.

Watch this video to learn more: https://click.pstmrk.it/3ts/youtu.be%2FKrwZHF7h1Sg/Tpyp/3e66AQ/AQ/2ce054a1-e6f1-4b1d-b0e7-0916d93d1ee2/7/qXY_Ms-LNs

- Check out our Dashboards docs here: https://click.pstmrk.it/3ts/docs.smith.langchain.com%2Fobservability%2Fhow_to_guides%23dashboards/Tpyp/3e66AQ/AQ/2ce054a1-e6f1-4b1d-b0e7-0916d93d1ee2/3/0c5_Mk6-51#dashboards
- Our blog: https://click.pstmrk.it/3ts/blog.langchain.dev%2Flangsmith-production-logging-automations%2F/Tpyp/3e66AQ/AQ/2ce054a1-e6f1-4b1d-b0e7-0916d93d1ee2/4/JS3c0gj2vZ
- And our YouTube series: https://click.pstmrk.it/3ts/www.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3D4rupAXVraEA%26list%3DPLfaIDFEXuae0bYV1_60f0aiM0qI7e1zSf/Tpyp/3e66AQ/AQ/2ce054a1-e6f1-4b1d-b0e7-0916d93d1ee2/5/IjY6DJnYWp

You’ve reached the end of our onboarding series — congrats! 🎉

But the journey doesn’t end here. We’d love to continue supporting you as you build with LangSmith. If you have any questions, join us in the Community Slack — we’d love to see you there: https://click.pstmrk.it/3ts/www.langchain.com%2Fjoin-community/Tpyp/3e66AQ/AQ/2ce054a1-e6f1-4b1d-b0e7-0916d93d1ee2/6/rer_Upf_x_

See you in the Slackverse!
Nick

Dear Priyank,

I hope this email finds you well. It was a pleasure connecting with you during the use case discussion. I wanted to summarize the key points discussed and share the commercials for your reference.

Use Case Discussion (13th January 2025):
Vendor Management & Collaboration - 


Vendor onboarding and amendments will be managed on the Dice platform.
Vendors on the vendor portal will have visibility into all transactions along with their respective statuses.
Vendors can initiate conversations with the concerned person for any particular transaction.
After transaction settlement, vendors will receive notifications, including settlement mode and UTR.

Integration with Microsoft Dynamics 365



Invoice submission and filing, along with approvals, will be handled on Microsoft Dynamics 365.
Dice will integrate with ERP to fetch invoice data.
Custom reports and analytics will be accessible on the admin dashboard, with respective access provided by the admin to business users.
Please review the above points and let us know if we missed anything and are eager to hear your feedback on the demo.

Next Steps -


 


As discussed during the meeting, we would like to hear your input and pointers for the preparation of the demonstration.


 


PFA the commercials for your reference.











 

Thanks & Regards,


Manish Patil


Sr. Account Executive

Dice Enterprise Private Limited

Hi Manohar,
 
Below are some additional points that might be relevant.
 


Company Name: Envogue International (Manoj Chirania is the owner / CEO)
One of the priority areas is for Manoj to maintain very strong relationships with their suppliers and warehouses.
They want to set-up a secure portal so they can share the data and interact with the vendors to improve the overall experience. These vendors are located globally, including China.
They currently share these via email or when requested by the vendors and is entirely manual. They do have Tableau reports as well but those are mainly used for internal consumption.

subject: (6/7) Automations for Your Production Data in LangSmith 🔄
body:
Once your app is in production, managing large volumes of data can quickly become a challenge. LangSmith automations streamline this process, saving you time and delivering faster insights to help you improve your app.

In LangSmith, you can set up automations to trigger as users interact with your production application. Some common automations include:

- Automatically adding traces marked with an “error” status to a dataset for later review
- Triggering a webhook to create tickets for further investigation
- Adding 10% of successful traces to a dataset for offline evaluation

You can also set up automated online evaluations. Using LLM-as-judge evaluators or custom code evaluators, you can automatically assess traces in real-time as users engage with your application. These evaluations feed into your dashboards, giving you instant feedback and monitoring at a glance.

Ready to set up automations? Let’s walk through it together in this video: https://click.pstmrk.it/3ts/youtu.be%2Fxj2R3lBgihs/Tpyp/neO6AQ/AQ/24b955bb-656d-4292-8b08-39976d2b681a/1/ewX6jqbImh

Check out our Automations docs here: https://click.pstmrk.it/3ts/docs.smith.langchain.com%2Fobservability%2Fhow_to_guides%23automations/Tpyp/neO6AQ/AQ/24b955bb-656d-4292-8b08-39976d2b681a/2/6dH_bQyM2I#automations
And our Online Evaluations docs here: https://click.pstmrk.it/3ts/docs.smith.langchain.com%2Fevaluation%2Fhow_to_guides%23online-evaluation/Tpyp/neO6AQ/AQ/24b955bb-656d-4292-8b08-39976d2b681a/3/vuz5IYsBRa#online-evaluation

Next, we’ll dive into LangSmith Dashboards.

Talk soon,
Nick

body:
Regards,

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Manohar Vashishta <manohar.vashishta@antrepriz.com>
Date: Wed, Nov 20, 2024 at 4:57 PM
Subject: Automating IndusInd’s Travel & Expense Management with Dice – Next
Steps
To: <reimbursement@indusind.com>, <pettycash@indusind.com>
Cc: <jerslin.vargheese@indusind.com>, Karthika Nadar <
nadar.karthika@indusind.com>, <sudhagar.subramani@indusind.com>, Tamilselvi
Sethu <tamilselvi.sethu@indusind.com>, <suresh.madivanan@indusind.com>,
Iyyappan Chellappan <iyyappan.chellappan@indusind.com>, <
bhuvaneswari.sundaram@indusind.com>, <mahendra.shirgaonkar@indusind.com>, <
shreya.dighe@indusind.com>, <gobind.jain@indusind.com>, <
raviabhishek.sharma@indusind.com>, <santoshy.kumar@indusind.com>, Ankur
Mathur <ankur@antrepriz.com>, Sonam Khubchandani <sonam@antrepriz.com>,
Abhishek Chaturvedi <abhishek.chaturvedi@antrepriz.com>


Hi Ms. Karpagam and CPPU Team,

Great connecting with all of you recently! Thanks for the time to deep dive
into the current processes at IndusInd Bank. Here’s a quick summary of the
key processes and next steps:

*Current Processes at IndusInd Bank:*
*a. Corporate Travel & Employee Expenses*

   - Employees (or EA’s) request approval for travel via email.
   - Travel admin coordinates with vendors (Maxima, Gilpin) for bookings
   via Email/call.
   - After travel, employees submit expenses via email and send the hard
   copy of the expense submission form with respective attachments through
   courier to the CPPU team.
   - CPPU team check the hard copies submitted by users and processes,
   validates and reimburses by pushing the file to ERP.

*b. Branch Petty Cash Management*

   - Employees will be provided with physical cash branch-wise and they
   spend by making merchant payments via cash for branch operational expenses
   - Employees upload the invoice and file the expenses on the internal
   platform.
   - CPPU team validates and processes payments. Data posted to Oracle
   Fusion.

*c. Local Claims (Mileage) Management*

   - Sales team / Employees who are on their feet on the street claim local
   conveyance through the internal platform by entering the total distance
   travelled manually.
   - Claims are validated by the CPPU team and posted to Oracle Fusion.

*Proposed Solution from Dice:*
An all-in-one expense management platform integrated with IndusInd's tech
stack (Adreline HRMS, Oracle Fusion, Google Maps), enabling all 30,000
users to efficiently manage employee travel, expenses, petty cash and
mileage claims. The solution features dynamic policies, workflow approvals,
tax mapping and audit capabilities, offering enhanced visibility for
finance teams and CFOs. It provides real-time analytics, custom reports and
flags violations or fraud in each transaction.

*Features:*

   - Configured travel, expense, petty cash and local conveyance policies.
   - GSTIN mapping for compliance (airline/hotel/cab vendors).
   - AI-powered OCR for invoice management, AI Audit & Compliance,
   real-time analytics.
   - Payment options via card, UPI, direct bank transfer.
   - Mobile and web access for employees to request, submit, approve and
   track expenses.

*Key Tech Capabilities:*

   - Integration with Oracle Fusion for parking and posting entries.
   - Fraud Prevention: AI-driven smart audits to detect duplicates,
   alcohol/cigarette/spa expenses, invalid payments, etc.
   - Security: Hosted on AWS with top-notch certifications (ISO 27001,
   GDPR, etc.).
   - Scalability: Supports 8.5L+ users, processing $6B+ transactions.

*Next Steps:*

   - Discussion with Travel & Admin team to discuss booking flow.
   - IT Security & Integration Call to align on HR & ERP integration.
   - Arrange reference calls with existing clients for feedback.

Feel free to reach out for any clarifications or further details!

Regards,


*Manohar+91 903 600 5577www.dice.tech <http://www.eka.io/> II Smarter Spend
Management*
Regards,Manohar+91 903 600 5577www.dice.tech II Smarter Spend Management---------- Forwarded message ---------From: Manohar Vashishta <manohar.vashishta@antrepriz.com>Date: Wed, Nov 20, 2024 at 4:57 PMSubject: Automating IndusInd’s Travel & Expense Management with Dice – Next StepsTo:  <reimbursement@indusind.com>,  <pettycash@indusind.com>Cc:  <jerslin.vargheese@indusind.com>, Karthika Nadar <nadar.karthika@indusind.com>,  <sudhagar.subramani@indusind.com>, Tamilselvi Sethu <tamilselvi.sethu@indusind.com>,  <suresh.madivanan@indusind.com>, Iyyappan Chellappan <iyyappan.chellappan@indusind.com>,  <bhuvaneswari.sundaram@indusind.com>,  <mahendra.shirgaonkar@indusind.com>,  <shreya.dighe@indusind.com>,  <gobind.jain@indusind.com>,  <raviabhishek.sharma@indusind.com>,  <santoshy.kumar@indusind.com>, Ankur Mathur <ankur@antrepriz.com>, Sonam Khubchandani <sonam@antrepriz.com>, Abhishek Chaturvedi <abhishek.chaturvedi@antrepriz.com>Hi Ms. Karpagam and CPPU Team,Great connecting with all of you recently! subject: Re: Vistar <> Dice.tech || Strategic Partnership
body:
Hi Jiten,

I hope this email finds you well. As we kick off the year, I’m thrilled to
share some significant milestones and discuss how we can collaborate to
create greater value together.

*Business Expansion*
We’ve started the year on a strong note by activating new markets in the
*MENA* region. We’ve successfully onboarded *2 new customers* and forged
strategic partnerships, including one product partner and two GTM partners
in KSA and UAE.

*Product Expansion*
With the launch of our LLM and AI-driven solutions, we’re excited to
introduce our range of GPT products, including *PayableGPT* and
*PurchaseGPT*. These innovations are designed to autonomously manage
payables and procurement functions, delivering efficiency and intelligence
to organizations.

Given your interest in partnering with us previously, I’d love to explore a
potential GTM partnership for the MENA region. As a testament to our
alignment, we’ve positioned ourselves as complementary to *Clear’s supply
chain financing*, ensuring no overlap in use cases and maximizing synergy.

I’d be keen to understand your roadmap and business priorities for the year
and explore how we can create a win-win partnership. How does* next week,
say Tuesday 12 PM *look for you*?*

Looking forward to hearing from you!

Hi Jiten,I hope this email finds you well. As we kick off the year, I’m thrilled to share some significant milestones and discuss how we can collaborate to create greater value together.Business ExpansionWe’ve started the year on a strong note by activating new markets in the MENA region. We’ve successfully onboarded 2 new customers and forged strategic partnerships, including one product partner and two GTM partners in KSA and UAE.Product ExpansionWith the launch of our LLM and AI-driven solutions, we’re excited to introduce our range of GPT products, including PayableGPT and PurchaseGPT. These innovations are designed to autonomously manage payables and procurement functions, delivering efficiency and intelligence to organizations.Given your interest in partnering with us previously, I’d love to explore a potential GTM partnership for the MENA region. As a testament to our alignment, we’ve positioned ourselves as complementary to Clear’s supply chain financing, ensuring no overlap in use cases and maximizing synergy.I’d be keen to understand your roadmap and business priorities for the year and explore how we can create a win-win partnership. How does next week, say Tuesday 12 PM look for you?Looking forward to hearing from you!On Thu, 26 Sep 2024 at 12:00 PM, Jiten Chablani <jiten.chablani@vistar.me> wrote:

Hi Foram and Shivani Ma'am,


 


Pleasure connecting with you both recently. In line with our discussion on the use cases for Vianaar, we are currently working with Lohono Stays on similar requirements
 within a comparable business model. For these properties, we are automating petty cash and utility bill payments using a QR mechanism for petty cash expenses and centralized utility payments through BBPS integration.

Regarding your query on GST charges for managed services related to utility bill payments, kindly have an internal discussion with Practus auditors. Based on my interactions with the business users at Lohono Stays, GST charges cannot be additionally levied
 on the bill amount, even for managed services like mobile bills, electricity bills, water bills or statutory bill payments.

@Ayush Shrivastava – Please share the use case deck and case study for Lohono Stays covering both petty cash and utility bill management. Collect the
 relevant data and provide the commercials accordingly.

Kindly let me know the next round of discussions with the relevant team to dive deeper into petty cash and payables automation.




Regards,






Manohar

www.dice.tech II Smarter Spend Management
